intro: Hippeastrum bulbulosum, commonly known as the Brazilian star百合, is a bulbous plant native to South America. It produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and red, typically blooming in late winter to early spring. The plant features strap-like, evergreen leaves that emerge from a central bulb. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Hippeastrum bulbulosum is popular as a ornamental plant due to its striking flowers and relatively easy care requirements.
